name: Graph

aliases.name: Graph
aliases.comment: A directed graph. `Graph Int String` is a graph that uses `Int`s for identifying its nodes, and lets you store a `String` on each node.

values.name: disableDagReachability
values.comment: Disable the dynamic reachability optimization for *directed acyclic graphs*.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: edges
values.comment: Get the (from, to) pair for each edge in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> List ( comparable, comparable )

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: enableDagReachability
values.comment:
Enable the dynamic reachability optimization for *directed acyclic graphs*. This allows `O(log n)` queries for the relative ordering of two elements in a partially ordered set, and `O(log n)` queries for the set of nodes that are reachable from a specific node.

The downside is that modifying the graph now takes `O(log n * (nodes before this node))` time on average. Modifying the beginning of the graph is thus quite fast, but inserting an edge at the end takes `O(n log n)` time. The other downside is that this optimization only works on directed acyclic graphs.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Maybe.Maybe (Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data)

values.name: foldl
values.comment: Fold over the node keys and data in a graph, in order from lowest `key` to highest `key`.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> a -> a) -> a -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> a

values.name: foldr
values.comment: Fold over the node keys and data in a graph, in order from highest `key` to lowest `key`.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> a -> a) -> a -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> a

values.name: getData
values.comment: Get the data associated with a specific node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Maybe.Maybe data

values.name: incoming
values.comment: Get the set of incoming edges to a node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Set.Set comparable

values.name: insertEdge
values.comment: Insert an edge between two nodes. Creates any nodes that do not already exist.
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: insertNode
values.comment: Insert a node. Does not overwrite metadata if node already exists.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: insertNodeData
values.comment: Update metadata for a node. Creates the node if it does not already exist.
values.type: comparable -> data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: intersect
values.comment: Create a graph based on the intersection of two graphs. If both graphs have the same node, edge or associated metadata, it will be in the resulting graph. If one graph has metadata and the other only has the node, the node will be in the resulting graph, but the metadata will not.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: isAcyclic
values.comment: Determine if a graph contains any loops or cycles.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Bool

values.name: keys
values.comment: Get the keys for all nodes in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> List comparable

values.name: map
values.comment: Apply a function to the data associated with each node in a graph.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data1 -> Maybe.Maybe data2) -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data1 -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data2

values.name: member
values.comment: Determine if a node identified by a key is in the graph.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Bool

values.name: memberEdge
values.comment: Determine if an edge identified by a pair of keys is in the graph.
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Bool

values.name: nodes
values.comment: Get the (key, data) pair for each node in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> List ( comparable, Maybe.Maybe data )

values.name: outgoing
values.comment: Get the set of outgoing edges from a node.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Set.Set comparable

values.name: partition
values.comment: Partition a graph into two parts, one with the nodes where the predicate function returned `True`, and one where it returned `False`.
values.type: (comparable -> Maybe.Maybe data -> Bool) -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> ( Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data , Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data )

values.name: postOrder
values.comment: Get a list of all keys according to a postorder traversal of a spanning tree of the graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> List comparable

values.name: reachable
values.comment: Get the set of reachable nodes from a key, following outgoing edges any number of steps.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Set.Set comparable

values.name: relativeOrder
values.comment: Returns the relative ordering of two keys in a *directed acyclic graph*. If there is a path from `a` to `b` over outgoing edges, `a` is `Before` `b`. If there is no path between them, they compare `Concurrent`.
values.type: comparable -> comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.RelativeOrdering.RelativeOrdering

values.name: removeEdge
values.comment: Remove an edge identified by its source and target keys. No-op if source, target or edge doesn't exist.
values.type: ( comparable, comparable ) -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: removeNode
values.comment: Remove a node by its key. No-op if node doesn't exist.
values.type: comparable -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

values.name: size
values.comment: Determine the number of nodes in the graph.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Int

values.name: topologicalSort
values.comment: Get a topological sorting of the graph, if the graph doesn't contain any loops or cycles.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Maybe.Maybe (List comparable)

values.name: union
values.comment: Join two graphs together. If an edge appears between two nodes in either of the graphs, it will be in the resulting graph. If a node identified by a specific key appears in any of the graphs, it will be in the resulting graph. If both graphs have metadata for the same key, the metadata in the left graph will be used.
values.type: Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data -> Graph.Internal.Graph comparable data

types.name: RelativeOrdering
types.comment: This type represents the relative ordering between two things in a graph.
